channel.title: In the Groove, Jazz and Beyond
channel.description: From Jazz masters of past and present to emerging new artists performing modern jazz and fusion. No smooth jazz here!
channel.itunes:subtitle: From the Jazz masters of past and present to emerging new artists performing hard bop jazz and fusion.
channel.itunes:summary: From the Jazz masters of past and present to emerging new artists performing hard bop jazz and fusion. A weekly Jazz radio show that airs on WHUS FM, Storrs CT. No smooth jazz here!
channel.itunes:author: Ken Laster

item.title: 2012 Jun 2 Broadcast
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: This show begins with Jazz pianist, composer and educator Noah Baerman. Noah also struggles with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), an incurable connective tissue disorder. Last month was EDS awareness month, and I had pledged to highlight EDS on this podcast. Please check out Noah’s blog post at his website ( http://noahjazz.com ) for more information. We [...]
item.content:encoded:
This show begins with Jazz pianist, composer and educator Noah Baerman. Noah also struggles with Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome (EDS), an incurable connective tissue disorder. Last month was EDS awareness month, and I had pledged to highlight EDS on this podcast. Please check out Noah’s blog post at his website ( http://noahjazz.com ) for more information. We feature other Connecticut jazz artists on this week’s show and some great jazz cats from Rochester NY. We have Jen Allen, Jimmy Greene, Noah Preminger, Frank Varela, Peter Greenfogel from CT, and Mike Melito and the Sneider Brothers from Rochester. Rounding out the show are Ambrose Akinmusire, Ornette Coleman, Chick Corea and John McLaughlin. This makes for a very eclectic mix. Hope you dig it.


EDS Blog post

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
This Little Light of Mine ~ Noah Baerman ~ Soul Force
The Repercussions ~ Jen Allen ~ Pieces of Myself
Love in Action ~ Jimmy Greene ~ Mission Statement
Law Years ~ Ornette Coleman ~ Science Fiction
Toy Dance ~ Noah Preminger ~ Before the Rain
Confessions to My Unborn Daughter ~ Ambrose Akinmusire ~ When the Heart Emerges Glistening
New Blues, Old Bruise ~ Chick Corea and John McLaughlin ~ Five Peace Band
Upstream ~ Frank Varela ~ Grandma’s Revenge
Tailwind ~ Mike Melito ~ The Right Time
It Must Schwing ~ Sneider Brothers ~ Brockton Beat
Halfway Between Places ~ Peter Greenfogel ~ Halfway Between Places

item.itunes:author: Ken Laster

item.title: Curtis Bro
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: This week’s podcast features our guest Zaccai Curtis and the music of the Curtis Brothers. We follow the development of their latin influenced jazz from the early Insight days when the band was based on young Hartford musicians, to a more mature evolved sound of the Curtis Brothers Quartet, and finally the recently released Hard-Bop [...]
item.content:encoded:
This week’s podcast features our guest Zaccai Curtis and the music of the Curtis Brothers. We follow the development of their latin influenced jazz from the early Insight days when the band was based on young Hartford musicians, to a more mature evolved sound of the Curtis Brothers Quartet, and finally the recently released Hard-Bop based Completion of Proof album. This latest band is comprised of some of Art Blakey’s alumni (Brian Lynch, Donald Harrison, Ralph Peterson). The Blakey influence is strong, but the Zaccai’s compositions maintain a subtle Latin flavor that the Curtis Brothers are so well known for. We start out the show with a Miles Davis piece, Footprints to celebrate the master’s birth date.

For more information on the Curtis Brothers, please check out their informative website.

Featured Album

The Curtis Brothers - Completion of Proof on CD Baby

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
Footprints ~ Miles Davis ~ Miles Smiles
Necessity ~ Insight ~ A Genesis
Sudan and Darfur ~ Insight ~ A Genesis
Yuba Citrico ~ Curtis Brothers Quartet ~ Blood Spirit Land Water Freedom
Sol Within ~ Curtis Brothers ~ Completion of Proof
Manifest Destiny ~ Curtis Brothers ~ Completion of Proof
item.itunes:subtitle: This week's podcast features our guest Zaccai Curtis and the music of the Curtis Brothers.
item.itunes:summary: This week's podcast features our guest Zaccai Curtis and the music of the Curtis Brothers. We follow the development of their latin influenced jazz from the early Insight days when the band was based of young Hartford musicians, to a more mature evolved sound of the Curtis Brothers Quartet, and finally the recently released Hard-Bop based Completion of Proof album. This latest band is comprised of some of Art Blakey's alumni (Brian Lynch, Joe Ford, Donald Harrison, Ralph Peterson). The Blakey influence is strong, but the Zaccai's compositions maintain a subtle Latin flavor that the Curtis Brothers are so well known for. We start out the show with a Miles Davis piece, Footprints to celebrate the master's birth date.
item.itunes:author: Ken Laster

item.title: New Jazz Workshop
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: This special 1 hour 40 minute edition of Jazz and Beyond features Jackie McLean, and an interview with Lummie Spann, alto sax player and co-founder of New Jazz Workshop. The show begins with a tribute to JMac, who would have been 81 years old this past week. Jackie meant so much to the Hartford jazz [...]
item.content:encoded:
This special 1 hour 40 minute edition of Jazz and Beyond features Jackie McLean, and an interview with Lummie Spann, alto sax player and co-founder of New Jazz Workshop. The show begins with a tribute to JMac, who would have been 81 years old this past week. Jackie meant so much to the Hartford jazz scene, including our on-air guest. Lummie Spann joins us live in the studio to talk about his latest musical project, the release of a new CD from the New Jazz Workshop. First Lummie speaks with us about his personal experiences with JMac and his development as a jazz musician in Hartford. The show continues with more music from Art Pepper, Skerik, Trane, Esperanza, Larry Young, and Lee Morgan.

Featured Album

New Jazz Workshop on CDBaby

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
Confirmation ~ Jackie McLean ~ New Wine in Old Bottles
Minor March ~ Jackie McLean ~ The Jackie Mac Attack
Optimism ~ Jackie McLean ~ Fire & Love
Underground ~ New Jazz Workshop ~ Underground on CDBaby

Summer Pudding ~ Skerik Syncopated Taint Septet ~ Live at the Triple Door
Naima ~ John Coltrane ~ Giant Steps
I Know You Know ~ Esperanza Spaulding ~ Esperanza
Mr. Pc ~ John Coltrane ~ Giant Steps
Softly as in a Morning Sunrise ~ Larry Young ~ Unity
Lost and Found ~ Lee Morgan ~ Expoobident
Pheonix ~ New Jazz Workshop ~ Underground

item.title: World Jazz Part 2
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: We continue our World music theme with part 2 of last week’s show and podcast. This week we begin with the latin rhythms of the Curtis Brothers and Flamenco music from Dave Holland. We then travel east and hear some interesting sounds from mandolin master Snehasish Mozumder. Fareed Haque, Vijay Iyer and the band Garaj [...]
item.content:encoded:
We continue our World music theme with part 2 of last week’s show and podcast. This week we begin with the latin rhythms of the Curtis Brothers and Flamenco music from Dave Holland. We then travel east and hear some interesting sounds from mandolin master Snehasish Mozumder. Fareed Haque, Vijay Iyer and the band Garaj Mahal show us different interpretations of Eastern influenced jazz fusion.

Featured Album

Jazz and North Indian Styles - Snehasish Mozumder & S.O.M. on iTunes

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
Bouncin with Bud ~ Curtis Brothers Quartet ~ Blood-Spirit-Land-Water-Freedom
Hands ~ Dave Holland and Pepe Habichuela ~ Hands
NY Seven ~ Snehasish Mozumder & SOM ~ Jazz and North Indian Styles
32 Taxis ~ Fareed Haque ~ Flat Planet
Entropy and Time ~ Vijay Iyer-Prasana-Nitin Mitta ~ Tirtha
Adana ~ Rudresh Mahanthapa Indo-Pak Coalition ~ Apti
Witch Doctor ~ Garaj Mahal ~ more mr. nice guy

item.title: World Jazz Part 1
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: Jazz is world music. This week (and next) we journey around the world with jazz music fused with rhythms and exotic sounds of Africa, India and Latin America. Sonny Rollins may have started the trend with his exploration of island calypso rhythms. Artists like Michele Rosewoman and Regina Carter have brought African sounds into their [...]
item.content:encoded:
Jazz is world music. This week (and next) we journey around the world with jazz music fused with rhythms and exotic sounds of Africa, India and Latin America. Sonny Rollins may have started the trend with his exploration of island calypso rhythms. Artists like Michele Rosewoman and Regina Carter have brought African sounds into their music, we also feature some Indian-Jazz fusion from composer Marc Rossi along with Prassana. Next week I will podcast Part 2 of this show with more world jazz.

Featured Album

Mantra Revealed - Marc Rossi Group on iTunes

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
St Thomas ~ Sonny Rollins ~ Saxophone Colosus
Jazz Impressions of a Kriti ~ Marc Rossi Group ~ Mantra Revealed
Refuge In The Rhythm ~ Marc Rossi Group ~ Mantra Revealed
Eshu Laroye ~ Michele Rosewoman and Quintessence ~ The In Side Out
Kanou ~ Regina Carter ~ Reverse Thread
Chcho’s Steps ~ Chucho Valdez & the African Cuban Messengers ~ Chucho’s Steps
item.itunes:subtitle: Jazz is world music. This week (and next) we journey around the world

item.title: Aja
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: This is one of the more eclectic mixes for an In The Groove podcast. Featured is Steely Dan’s Aja album, but the styles run from Straight Ahead (Donald Byrd, Curtis Fuller, Hancock, Mingus) to Fusion (Indian influenced Prasanna, Weather Report). Dig the piano trio from Noah Baerman who will bring his soulful sounds to Titanium [...]
item.content:encoded:
This is one of the more eclectic mixes for an In The Groove podcast. Featured is Steely Dan’s Aja album, but the styles run from Straight Ahead (Donald Byrd, Curtis Fuller, Hancock, Mingus) to Fusion (Indian influenced Prasanna, Weather Report). Dig the piano trio from Noah Baerman who will bring his soulful sounds to Titanium in Middletown CT next Friday May 4.

Featured Album

Aja - on iTunes

Track ~ Artist ~ Album

Uncensored ~ Prasanna ~ Be the Change
Boogie Stop Shuffle ~ Charles Mingus ~ Mingus Ah Um
I Got the News ~ Steely Dan ~ Aja
Down Tempo ~ Donald Byrd ~ Off to the Races
Home At Last ~ Steely Dan ~ Aja

item.title: Seeds
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: This podcast features the new release from Kenny Garrett, Seeds from the Underground. I was fortunate to attend a recent performance of Mr. Garrett’s and I can say that this release is indicative of the intensity and virtuosity that he, and his quintet, display in concert. Also, I recently re-discovered one of Weather Reports [...]
item.content:encoded:
This podcast features the new release from Kenny Garrett, Seeds from the Underground. I was fortunate to attend a recent performance of Mr. Garrett’s and I can say that this release is indicative of the intensity and virtuosity that he, and his quintet, display in concert. Also, I recently re-discovered one of Weather Reports original albums which I share with you here. Some very upbeat songs follow from Esperanza’s new album and a re-release of an older album from Hubert Laws. Finally, Greg Abate lays us onto some new tracks he recently recorded with sax great Phil Woods and we play one of them here.

Featured Album

Seeds from the Underground - Kenny Garrett

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
J.Mac ~ Kenny Garrett ~ Seeds From the Underground
Du-Wo-Mo ~ Kenny Garrett ~ Seeds From the Underground
Medley ~ Weather Report ~ I Sing The Body Electric
Second Sunday in August ~ Weather Report ~ I Sing The Body Electric
Smile Like That ~ Esperanza Spaulding ~ Radio Music Society
Moment’s Notice ~ Hubert Laws ~ In the Beginning
Carmel By The Sea ~ Greg Abate ~ Untitled Album

Also, I recently re-discovered one of Weather Reports original albums which I share with you hear. Some very upbeat songs follow from Esperanza's new album and a re-release of an older album from Hubert Laws. item.title: A Spacey Groove
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description:
We venture into “The Beyond” with this week’s podcast. From Jimi Hendrix to Mahavishnu to Robert Glasper, we span time and space. So get into that altered state of mind and enjoy this spaced out groove. Featured Album
Electric Ladyland - The Jimi Hendrix Experience
Track ~ Artist ~ Album
EXP/Up From the Skies ~ The Jimi Hendrix [...]
item.content:encoded:

item.title: April 7 Broadcast Show
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: To start this show, we get into Kenny Garrett prior to his performance in Boston that we attended last night. Then some straight ahead jazz from Art Blakey, Josh Evans and Joe Henderson. We then change it up with new releases from Jack DeJohnette and vocals from Kate McGary. The show wraps up with jazz [...]
item.content:encoded:
To start this show, we get into Kenny Garrett prior to his performance in Boston that we attended last night. Then some straight ahead jazz from Art Blakey, Josh Evans and Joe Henderson. We then change it up with new releases from Jack DeJohnette and vocals from Kate McGary. The show wraps up with jazz from Rochester’s Sneider Brothers.

Featured Album

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
Calling ~ Kenny Garrett ~ Beyond the Wall
Lonnie’s Lament ~ Kenny Garrett ~ Pursuance: The Music of John Coltrane
A La Mode ~ Art Blakey and the Jazz Messenters ~ Keystone 3
Albany Ave ~ Josh Evans ~ Portrait
Mode for Joe ~ Joe Henderson ~ Mode for Joe
Y Todavia La Quiero ~ Joe Henderson ~ Relaxin’ at Camarillo
Indigo Dreamscapes ~ Jack DeJohnette ~ Sound Travels
O Cantador ~ Kate McGary ~ Girl Talk
From This Moment On ~ The Sneider Brothers ~ The Brockton Beat
item.itunes:subtitle: To start this show, we get into Kenny Garrett
item.itunes:summary: To start this show, we get into Kenny Garrett prior to his performance in Boston that we attended last night. Then some straight ahead jazz from Art Blakey, Josh Evans and Joe Henderson. We then change it up with new releases from Jack DeJohnette and vocals from Kate McGary. The show wraps up with jazz from Rochester's Sneider Brothers.
item.itunes:keywords: jazz, kenny garrett, art blakey, kate mcgary,
item.itunes:author: Ken Laster

item.title: March 31 Broadcast
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: Much of this show is requests from some of our friends and listeners as well as some of my favorites. Claire asked to hear the Dirty Dozen Brass Band and Jimmy Greene, Whitney requested Sarah Vaughan, and Bryan has been wanting a Joe Henderson set. I really dug the Henderson tracks and I think there [...]
item.content:encoded:
Much of this show is requests from some of our friends and listeners as well as some of my favorites. Claire asked to hear the Dirty Dozen Brass Band and Jimmy Greene, Whitney requested Sarah Vaughan, and Bryan has been wanting a Joe Henderson set. I really dug the Henderson tracks and I think there will be more of that to come in the following weeks. The podcast concludes with a gorgeous intense ballad from Branford Marsalis that I think you will enjoy.

Featured Album

Relaxin’ At Camarillo - Joe Henderson on iTunes

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
Mass Manipulation ~ The Curtis Brothers ~ Completion of Proof
Just One of those Things ~ Sarah Vaughan ~ Ultimate SV
Minions Dominions ~ Defeayo Marsalis ~ Minions Dominions
Dead Dog on the Street ~ The Dirty Dozen Brass Band ~ Buck Jump
Anthem of Hope ~ Jimmy Greene ~ The Overcomer’s Suite
Black ~ Joe Henderson ~ Mode for Joe
Relaxin at the Camarillo ~ Joe Henderson ~ Relaxin at the Camarillo
Hope ~ Branford Marsalis ~ Braggtown

The podcast concludes with a gorgeous intense ballad from Branford Marsalis that I think you will enjoy.

item.title: Radio Music
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description: This week we feature another highly anticipated release in jazz. Esperanza Spaulding’s Radio Music Society follows her Grammy award for best new artist. We play two tracks from the album, released this week. We follow with more new music from jazz harmonica player Gregoire Maret, and pianist Vijay Iyer. More music follows from Jeremy Pelt [...]
item.content:encoded:
This week we feature another highly anticipated release in jazz. Esperanza Spaulding’s Radio Music Society follows her Grammy award for best new artist. We play two tracks from the album, released this week. We follow with more new music from jazz harmonica player Gregoire Maret, and pianist Vijay Iyer. More music follows from Jeremy Pelt and JD Allen, both of which appeared in the Hartford area this week. We keep with a local twist from Greg August the Curtis Brothers and Gary Smulyan who has a new release, Smul’s Paradise.

Featured Album

Radio Music Society - Esperanza Spalding on iTunes

Track ~ Artist ~ Album
Jazz Ain’t Nothin But Soul ~ Esperanza Spalding ~ Radio Music Society
I Can’t Help It ~ Esperanza Spalding ~ Radio Music Society
Travels ~ Gregoire Maret ~ Gregoire Maret
Human Nature ~ Accelerando ~ Vijay Iyer Trio
Accelerando ~ Vijay Iyer ~ Accelerando
Backroad ~ Jeremy Pelt ~ Men of Honor
The Wrath ~ JD Allen Trio ~ Victory!
Change of Course ~ Greg August Sextet ~ One Peace
The Wrath ~ Curtis Brothers ~ Completion of Proof
Up in Betty’s Room ~ Gary Smulyan ~ Smul’s Paradise

item.title: Last Week part 2
item.dc:creator: jazzandbeyond
item.description:
This podcast is the second hour of last week’s show. We play new and old tracks from Chick Corea. We follow with the featured album from drummer Johnathan Blake, his first as a leader. Next up is Robert Glasper and Esperanza Spaulding from their latest releases, both highly anticipated and important jazz albums. Featured Album
The Eleventh [...]
item.content:encoded:
This podcast is the second hour of last week’s show. We play new and old tracks from Chick Corea. We follow with the featured album from drummer Johnathan Blake, his first as a leader. Next up is Robert Glasper and Esperanza Spaulding from their latest releases, both highly anticipated and important jazz albums.

Featured Album

The Eleventh Hour - Johnathan Blake on iTunes
